title: Anticipation through Head Pose Estimation: a preliminary study
abstract:
The ability to anticipate others' goals and intentions is at the basis of
human-human social interaction. Such ability, largely based on non-verbal
communication, is also a key to having natural and pleasant interactions with
artificial agents, like robots. In this work, we discuss a preliminary
experiment on the use of head pose as a visual cue to understand and anticipate
action goals, particularly reaching and transporting movements. By reasoning on
the spatio-temporal connections between the head, hands and objects in the
scene, we will show that short-range anticipation is possible, laying the
foundations for future applications to human-robot interaction.
